intro: Cybianthus albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cybianthus albiflorus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
